awd_abstract_narration:
This award is made as part of the FY 2019 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Tony Feng is " The relative Langlands program over function fields".  The host institution for the fellowship is MIT and the sponsoring scientist is Wei Zhang.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
In this Project, the PI investigated several interrelated mathematical problems concerning the interaction of representation theory, which is the study of linearization of symmetries, and automorphic forms, which is about the arithmetic of special functions. 

 

One of the major advances was new insight into the theory of theta functions, which were discovered by Jacobi in 1834. In the late 20th century, Kudla discovered a variant of theta functions called arithmetic theta functions. The author in joint work with Yun and (the Fellowship sponsor) Zhang has constructed an infinite sequence of "higher" theta functions, of which Jacobi's theta functions and Kudla's arithmetic theta functions can be seen as the first two entries. Moreover, this work debuts the application of a powerful new tool called "derived geometry" into the study of theta functions. 

 

The PI (co)wrote 8 papers, averaging over 50 pages in length, and delivered about 30 research lectures disseminating these works, at seminars and conferences across the country. The PI has 8 ongoing collaborations from work started during this Fellowship. 

 

In terms of broader impacts, the PI taught two graduate minicourses and supervised two undergraduates in advanced reading projects. He developed a curriculum for an undergraduate course on p-adic numbers. 


Last Modified: 10/17/2022
Modified by: Tony Feng
